newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX natgas ends mixed, fronts off but hold range.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX natgas ends mixed, fronts off but hold range.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were mixed Monday in a sluggish session, with fronts closing down slightly but still holding recent ranges in the face of uncertainty about market direction, sources said.
July eased 0.2 cent to close at $2.147 per million British thermal units. August settled one cent lower at $2.157. Other months ended mixed, with some 1999s scoring modest gains.
"Cash was up today and I think the heat in Texas helped, but without more heat or hurricanes soon, I think these (price) levels could be difficult to sustain," said one Midwest trader.

With Midwest and Northeast temperatures this week expected to stay around normal and extended forecasts showing no consensus, few expected a significant rally near-term, adding heat in Texas was not enough to firm the market.

Chart traders said recent ranges were intact, with July support still at last week's low of $2.055 and then at $2. After $2.21 and $2.25, technicians pegged July resistance at $2.37 and then at the $2.44 contract high.

In the cash Monday, Louisiana Gulf Coast gas firmed by about five cents to the mid-teens or higher. Midcon pipes gained a similar amount to the low-$2s. New York city gate gas also was about a nickel higher in the low-to-mid $2.40s.
The NYMEX 12-month Henry Hub strip slipped 0.6 cent to $2.231. NYMEX said 25,577 contracts traded, down from Friday's revised tally of 42,848.

On the KCBT, July finished 0.3 cent lower at $2.01, while deferreds ended down by one-half cent. The East/West spread widened by 0.1 cent to 13.7 cents (NYMEX premium). KCBT said 387 lots traded, up from Friday's total of 187.
